page.title: 20BEDFORD RURAL LABOUR PARTY
page.content: 11 Riseley residents belong to Bedford Rural Labour Party which has 45 members. Council elections the labour candidate for this ward came third with 364 votes. Members leafletted the village. Following last years support of the miners' famalies during the strike,one family is again having a boy to stay during the summer holiday. A barbecue was held on June 22nd attended by 55 people including local Tories. A public meeting is planned for September 24th when David Blunkett ,the blind leader of Sheffield County Council,will speak at the village hall.There have been successful visits to the village by national figures, Shirley Williams & Barbara Castle. The Liberal candidate came 2nd with 467 votes in this years County Council election.
